Download and copy the necessary .deb files to cd, copy them over to the internet-less box. then use dpkg -i <packagename> to install them

OK, and on the computer it is going to, what version of ubuntu is it? Dapper, edgy feisty etc

Back. Get any help yet? If not, go: !info wine <my ubuntu distname>     where distname is what ubuntu you have like dapper,edgy or feisty. then go in the windoze box top http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/w/wine/ and download the version which it says is for your dist. then copy that to your usb stick and you should be able to copy it over then install it to the ubuntu box by: sudo dpkg -i <packagename>

when I try dpkg it says that package does not exist

Copy the file you downloaded, like  wine_0.9.33-0ubuntu1_i386.deb  for instance, into /home/yourusername     then go to a terminal and put: cd ~  then: sudo dpkg -i wine_0.9.33-0ubuntu1_i386.deb      (if that was the exact name of the package you had for instance)
